column4: anyone can explain the wording of ubuntu trademark: we will sponsor registration fees for approved domains, and leave technical administrative control in the hands of the website operator.
thats two types of directly :) one where you do the talking and two where you do it now
about getting ubuntu registered in your country and all sorts of funky stuff there
jeff said that ubuntu is own by canonical
do you know what is the restriction of ubuntu?
talk to canonical - the people who own it - there are very very few restrictions - they are all good ones
i know GPL :) but the logo? is it GPL?

for definitive answers talk to canonical - the logo has copyrights - they will allow you use it if you can comply with certain restrictions - they know what they are - if you want to do something with their stuff you need to talk to them
you can get all the info you need here: http://www.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/TrademarkPolicy/view?searchterm=logo
read the trademark doc - it says what you have to do to use it - and some of what you can't do

it is not built for breezy nor will it be, but you then have to manage any issues yourself you loose the security of the distro, as in others managing problems they become yours do this with 10 packages and you now have to watch a lot of stuff
